Description: Attic red-figured pottery pyxis, type D, with lid. Lid: reserved groove just below top; underside, reserved with black disc and circle; on top, red-figure decoration consisting of table (three legs ending in lions’ paws) standing on double reserved band with possible loaf of bread on top. Box: ring foot in two degrees: interior: reserved; exterior: glazed black, with reserved groove above foot; underside reserved with graffito. Contains powder of deep red ochre colour; inscription on underside of both parts.
Bibliographic references: Vase / Catalogue of Vases in the British Museum (E771)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0819) (Phase 1)
